page.title: 01MAREFIELD/LOWESBY AREA
page.content: This is open rolling country drained by two streams flowing north-westerly to the River Wreake.There are two small areas of nucleated settlement and several dispersed farmsteads. { Farming}is by far the main occupation of the area;{mixed farming}being pre- dominant.Local Authority services are provided by Market Harborough District Council but the population looks towards Melton Mowbray and Leicester for markets,shopping and entertainment facilties. The{B6047}Melton Mowbray to Market Harborough road is the main route of communication through the area with one rural bus service weekly. The area contains the villages of Marefield and Lowesby,the{John O'Gaunt {Fox Covert}maintained by the Quorn Hunt, and{Lowesby Hall}set in private ornamental parkland.
